root_cause: Contextual overrides (top-50, power conf, 200+, March, line range) were 78%+ in-sample but coin-flip OOS. Pure regression alone: 65.1% OOS. Overrides dragged to 52.2%.
phase_1_findings: Core features stable: avgTempo (0.7%), sumAdjOE (24%), sumAdjDE (26%)
lessons_learned: FanMatch data is unavailable for 2026 (2.7% coverage) — any model using fmTotal is training on signal but testing on zeros
Moneyline data is 0% for 2025 — ML edge signal unverifiable
Data quality is perfect — no cleanup needed
Ridge regularization shrinks unstable features automatically — better than manual feature selection
Hand-crafted overrides are the #1 overfitting risk — always validate OOS before adding
Spread model look-ahead bias: KenPom season-level ratings inflate 2026 spread accuracy (65.7% suspect)
